title: Jeremy Smith (rugby league, born 1981)
text:
Jeremy James Smith (born 18 July 1981) is a New Zealand former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who previously played for the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> and the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>, and the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford City Reds</a> and the <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity Wildcats</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>. Primarily playing as a or , Smith has represented the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> and <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand national</a> teams.
Playing career.
A <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George Dragons</a> junior, Smith made the <a href="Junior%20Kiwis">Junior Kiwis</a> in 1998. He played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">Aotearoa Māori</a> side at the <a href="2000%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2000 World Cup</a>. In 2001 he played for the <a href="Hibiscus%20Coast%20Raiders">Hibiscus Coast Raiders</a> in the <a href="Bartercard%20Cup">Bartercard Cup</a>.
Smith played for the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> between 2005 and 2006. Smith was suspended for 4 matches in 2006 after pushing a referee in Parramatta's bizarre 8–1 loss to St George. The judiciary had found that Smith pushed referee Sean Hampstead in the back with both hands after a scrum was ruled against Parramatta. He has also represented the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Maori</a> side.
Smith then signed with South Sydney for the 2007 season. He penned his deal short after the announcement that his coach at the time, <a href="Jason%20Taylor%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jason Taylor</a> would also join the Rabbitohs in 2007.
Smith joined the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford City Reds</a> at the beginning of the 2009 season.
Smith again played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> in 2010 against <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>.
Smith has signed a 1-year deal with <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> outfit, <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity Wildcats</a> ahead of the 2011 season. Smith was injured during the off season and could not play in any friendlies due to visa problems, which meant he had little match fitness when he made his début in Round 3 against Salford.
He returned to Australia in 2012, signing with the <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra Dragons</a> and playing <a href="NSW%20Cup">NSW Cup</a> for the <a href="Illawarra%20Cutters">Illawarra Cutters</a>.
